docx_questions.text: What is the functional unit of the kidney called?
Which cells have phagocytic properties similar to monocytes and contract like smooth muscles cells, thereby influencingNtUheRSgIlNoGmTeBru.ClaOrMfiltration rate?
What part of the kidney controls renal blood flow, glomerular filtration, and renin secretion?
Kidney stones in the upper part of the ureter would produce pain referred to which anatomical area?
Innervation of the bladder and internal urethral sphincter is supplied by which nerves?
How much urine accumulates in the bladder before the mechanoreceptors sense bladder fullness?
What is the trigone?
options: smooth muscle that comprises the orifice of the ureter
The inner mucosal lining of the kidneys
smooth triangular area between the openings of the two ureters and the urethra
One of the three divisions of the loop of Henle

docx_questions.text: The glomerular filtration rate is directly related to which factor?
options: Perfusion pressure in the glomerular capillaries
iffusion rate in the renal cortex
iffusion rate in the renal medulla

docx_questions.text: On average, what percent of cardiac output do the kidneys receive?
What effects do exercise and body position have on renal blood flow?
options: Exercise and body position activate renal parasympathetic neurons and cause mild vasoconstriction.
They activate renal sympathetic neurons and cause mild vasoconstriction.
oth activate renal parasympathetic neurons and cause mild vasodilation.
They activate renal sympathetic neurons and cause mild vasodilation.

docx_questions.text: When renin is released, it is capable of which action?
What effect do natriuretic peptides have during heart failure when the heart dilates?
What is the direct action of atrial natriuretic hormone?
What term is used to identify the movement of fluids and solutes from the tubular lumen to the peritubular capillary plasma?
How high does the plasma glucose have to be before the threshold for glucose is achieved?
Which hormone is required for water to be reabsorbed in the distal tubule and collecting duct?
Which glycoprotein protects against urolithiasis and is a ligand for lymphokines?
What is the end-product of protein metabolism that is excreted in urine?
What is the action of urodilatin?
options: Urodilatin causes vasoconstriction of afferent arterioles.
It causes vasodilation of the efferent arterioles.
It inhibits salt and water reabsorption.

docx_questions.text: The concentration of the final urine is determined by antidiuretic hormone (ADH), which is secreted by which gland?
Which statement is true regarding urodilatin?
options: Urodilatin inhibits sodium chloride and water reabsorption in the medullary part of the collecting duct.
It inhibits antidiuretic hormone (ADH) to prevent water reabsorption in the medullary part of the collecting duct.
Urodilatin is stimulated by a rise in blood pressure and an increase in extracellular volume.
It is stimulated by a fall in blood pressure and a decrease in extracellular volume.

docx_questions.text: What substance stimulates renal hydroxylation in the process of producing vitamin D?
Which hormone is synthesized and secreted by the kidneys?
What provides the best estimate of the functioning of renal tissue?
options: Serum blood urea nitrogen and creatinine
The specific gravity of the solute concentration of the urine

docx_questions.text: Which renal change is found in older adults?
options: Sharp decline in glomerular filtration rate
Sharp decline in renal blood flow
ecrease in the number of nephrons

docx_questions.text: Compared with a younger individual, how is the specific gravity of urine in older adults affected?
options: Specific gravity of urine in older adults is increased.
Specific gravity of urine in older adults is considered high normal.
Specific gravity of urine in older adults is considered low normal.
Specific gravity of urine in older adults is decreased.

docx_questions.text: What process allows the kidney to respond to an increase in workload?
Which process makes it possible for ureters to be transplanted successfully?
